I don't have much of a drinking problem these days. In fact I'm surprised I even drank last night. I was on benzos - I've never mixed benzos with alcohol - but I had some in the fridge still from Christmas and for some reason I decided to try out a little bit, and continued until I was fucked up, and then decided to go for a drive.

I'm well aware of how fucking stupid it is; how easily I could have ruined my life or killed myself or someone else. It's not the first time something like this has happened, either. One time last year I was mixing my benzos with baclofen (it's a potent combo) and I must have reached a rather ridiculous number of each before deciding to take a drive to mcdonalds. Another instance last year I drank heavily the day after taking like 4 benzos, and ended up blacking out surprisingly quick. I woke up in my bed with no recollection of what had happened and traces of vomit on my jumper. What scares me the most is the possibility of killing myself like that and leaving it for my mum to find me in that state.

I don't know. I'm scared. I honestly am. This kind of thing doesn't happen often, but it seems all I need to do is slip up once and I could totally fuck up my life if not worse.

I'm taking some pre-emptive action by making sure there's no alcohol in the house from now on and getting rid of all the meds save the benzos. I don't see myself making the decision to drink while sober, but I worry the influence of other drugs will tempt me (like it did last night). I might have to give up driving or take antabuse indefinitely or something like that otherwise.

>>28273947
How far progressed is his cachexia (cancer-induced wasting syndrome). Has he already lost his appetite completely? Is he already skin and bones?
Is he in chronic pain? Does he have access to powerful pain-relieving medication and someone to help him in his final days/weeks?

If he has some fight left in him then he may want to try prolonged fasting to see if he can put it back into remission:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6JD_JzprK5U
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wiGVsUtCZwI
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YzPrxku1x5Y

I wrote up something for an anon here a year or two ago who was in a similar position to you which may explain the fasting process if you and him are interested in going down that road:

https://pastelink.net/wl9cnuuj

Although it was written for someone else, most of it should apply to your situation.
However, if the cachexia has already progressed too far it may be too late for him. And if so then what you want to focus on instead is pain-relief, comfort and care. During the last stages he'll need diaper changes, he'll need to be moved around in bed, he may need bed sores treated with ointment and bandages and things of that nature.

As for the debt situation, it may be better to have him come to you if that's at all possible. I'm not sure what country he's from but if you're at risk of danger of not being able to settle his debts, and will have to face punishment for it, then you may want to do everything possible to get him on a plane so he can stay where you're staying. However, I'm assuming that's probably not possible but I figured I'd mention it at least.

If you have any questions about any of this I'll pop back into this thread at some point to answer them.

posts.sub: Why is it impossible to find a girlfriend?
posts.com:
Correct me if I'm wrong but it comes down to three basic requirements: genetic attractiveness, superficial charm, and socioeconomic status. If you possess at least one of those three attributes, you have a chance of finding a girlfriend. You have to understand that women generally have an abundance of options available to them. They're not going to settle for anything less than they feel they deserve. Women have a biological imperative to choose the best physical specimen for their future offspring, even if they don't actively want children, it's hardwired into them. Similarly, they will also seek a man who can provide them with comfort and security. Pretty much every relationship can be boiled down to this. Sure, personality and compatibility are factors but all relationships start with a hook. My best friend is 6'6 and has chiseled features. He's never single for long. My other friend is short, chubby and has cerebral palsy BUT he has a well-paid job and shitton of savings. He finally found a girl to date him. I've also known plenty of guys who weren't particularly handsome but they were total arrogant scumbags. They always had girlfriends. I could go on and on...
So, if you're wondering why you're perennially single, this will be the reason. Unfortunately, most of these traits are out of your control. Genetics are predetermined, superficial charm is a character quirk, and status/money usually comes from a solid upbringing and the right opportunity.

I'm a britbong. I'm a teacher (for an essential subject). I have my degree and master's cert.

In 12 days, I plan to buy a tent, a small portable barbecue, and a bag or two of charcoal. I'm going to drive out to bumfuck nowhere, burn the charcoal til it smoulders, then take it in the tent. I'm going to take a shit load of gaba (it's not toxic - it just makes you tingly, like you've drunk too much, and sleepy too), maybe a few drinks, listen to some music, and just go to sleep.

I thought about rope, but it's noisy, you need an anchor point... Guns you need a license for, and frankly I can't install a cabinet to get a license right now. Pill poisoning is for women. I've seen the gnarly results of poorly slit wrists. CO poisoning seems like a relatively calm and peaceful way to die. It will be at a point where everyone around me is busy, schools will be out so work will be off, and I will be least visible.

I almost lost my life a few times. I wanted to do something worthwhile with my second chances. But I could do nothing. I'm of no value to anyone. I fooled myself into thinking that if a life not well lived, then a life used well might be worth it. Facing so many hills and barriers hasn't made me stronger, it's made me more hateful. That's all I have anymore, this dull, lingering hate for everything around me. My pets, my family, my coworkers, the children I teach... I just hate every moment of it. Don't see that changing.

What I want to know:
1) How can I ensure this is successful? I.e., types of tent, types of charcoal, shit I might not know.
2) What music should I listen to when I go into the tent?
3) What's the best way to make this look accidental? I should want to 'get everyone' and make them feel bad or whatever, but that's just juvenile. I'd rather these ill feelings just, ended with me.

I think a decent psychiatrist would help me present my case, but I'm so depressed I can't function much less go hunting for a psychiatrist. I have little faith in the mental health system where I live because of the shit luck I've had in the past.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
NEETbucks aka Disability checks

you apply at the social security administration. most applications are denied. then you appeal and its usually denied again. then you appeal another time and get a hearing before an administrive law judge. they will review the case and ask you questions about the evidence you presented. then make a decision about awarding or denying benefits.

this process takes 1-3 years. that is unless you have a rock solid case where its undeniable that you cannot do any meaningful work for a long term; some people do get awarded disability the first time they apply.

physical and mental disability are both hard to prove you cant work. for mental disability, the stronger cases are the ones where people claim they hear voices and get prescribed strong anti-psychotics by a doctor or psychiatrist. for years. if its some soft mental issue like trouble socializing, the social security administration usually says "you could count beans in a factory working alone" or something ridiculous like that. if you try to use "aspergers" or another soft mental issue where it hinders people but doesnt prevent them from doing SOME JOBS, then you will likely fail. the whole thing will be a waste of your time. the SS administration will look at the evidence. not your personal story of woe. You gotta make yourself seen as totally unable to engage in meaningful employment.

(1/2)

if you are at the very start of the process, get a psychiatrist. lie to them about hearing voices. do research online about schizophrenia and auditory hallucinations. locate some shitty psychiatrist in the ghetto. shitty office, cheap, some fuckup. then lie to them about your auditory hallucinations. get the prescriptions written. make regular appointments. then after 1-2 months apply for social security disability.

If all else fails, strip naked downtown and yell about religious stuff. Get arrested, taken to a psych ward, and officially diagnosed. Then you can apply and get fast-tracked.

>>28274706
>I don't think having sex inside of relationships is quite the same as whoring though.
They both accept sex without commitment. Sex while dating accepts the possibility of future commitment (and also accepts the likelihood that your first partner won't be your only one--so nonmonogamy). Hookups just make clear that commitment won't happen.

>And people's values change.
>it's about having some hope of maybe someday meeting someone with similar values, who doesn't hold virginity as a non-negotiable.
There's a big difference between regretting past actions and wishing that nobody would care about that kind of past. A guy who also regretted his past and didn't feel entitled to demand perfection where he was flawed would be one thing to be grateful for. A guy who still fucks around and never cared about restraint or monogamy in the first place is another thing entirely.
Also, if someone's values genuinely changed, they should be the first to accept the consequences for their actions. It should be obvious that someone who is relieved at someone else's lack of concern for a certain value doesn't really care about the same value, either.

There's no point in berating someone who genuinely regrets what they did in the past, and they do deserve support and empathy, but that doesn't mean they should be unconditionally accepted, either. Telling people that they can be entirely forgiven as soon as they express guilt, especially in a society with tons of pressure to do the wrong thing, is in effect encouraging them to try out wrongdoing, since they can try to fit in and just press a reset button if they don't like it. But this ignores the intrinsic harm of what they did, both to themselves and society.

>>28275108
Eugenics and pursuit of aestheticism are virtually one to one, although half of eugenics is simply seeking to eliminate populations which are despised for ideological reasons. Eliminating the disabled is a form of removing that which isn't considered aesthetic, eliminating criminals is ideological. The point of eugenics is to eventually eliminate a trait entirely: numerical size of the population doesn't make it less susceptible to being devastated by an illness the approved group is especially susceptible to. Most traits have tradeoffs, eliminating one might eliminated a "weakness," but it also eliminates a strength which could've been desperately needed in the face of a catastrophic emergency (ie. a desperately needed blood type others would need, etc.)

But again, eugenics has fallen out of favor because it rapidly spirals out of control for political reasons. People begin being eliminated not because it improves the species or reduces crime, but because it eliminates people which the state doesn't like for unfounded, highly emotional reasons.

Eugenics is a self-destructive pseudo-science which is best left in the past.

posts.sub: I am legit confused about which direction taking in my life as an artist, need help.
posts.com:
I am planning to find another hobby that goes hand in hand with drawing (I am barely intermediate at this too as well, and my grasp of fundamentals is still kinda shit) since I want to start making projects with my characters and ideas while also evolving my skills.

The problem is that I feel too old for starting now, and it will probably take a lot, probably even decades before making "the game of my dreams" based on JRPGs like SaGa or classic Final Fantasy but with my own OCs and lore. Not to mention that while it might give me benefits in terms of notority, I have the fear my drawing skills will level up on a slower pace since I am sustaining 2 hobbies that need a lot of work to get good at and I will eventually not have that much free time as I keep getting older.

The alternative is trying to get into webcomics and hoping to make something successful if learning gamedev takes too much, but everything I come up with seems too derivative of media I was obsessed with through my life (plenty of classic manga that not much people know about in the west + some european comics, so my work would seem way more familiar to spanish/latin american/italian/french audiences than anglo ones). Thoughts? I don't want to crawl away and end up being another coom artist on Twatter or another soulless Artstation husk.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com: Most people's early work in art is derivative. Even dreams can be derivative (in fact most are). If you like certain themes that's fine. Just try to make things less than predictable. If your skills are only intermediate thats fine too. Ever read one punch man? That became popular even though the art was amateur at best. It was the plot that appealed to people. Lean into your lore, and your plots and see where that takes you. Good luck.

Step 1. Get yourself a male role model. You are clearly lacking one, so get one.

Step 2. Work is not about passion, that's a meme. Work is about making money to live. You have to be good at your job, liking it isn't a factor. Go for the highest paying job you'd be genuinely good at. This is the purpose of work experience in high school to get to understand what a job is like and experiment with what you're good at.

Look at hiring a careers counsellor, and check out the skills shortage list for your country.

Step 3. Finding a sense of identity is an internal process that takes time. You'll get there. Perhaps seek a psychologist to help you along your way and make sense/order out of your life.

>>28273217
It sounds like you're dealing with a lot. In the case of doubts like this, don't look too far into the future but instead stay focused on the now.

For example, instead of thinking "Will I ever find a partner? Will I get sick? Will I ever get better?", you can try focusing on the more immediate questions like:

How do I feel right now?
What do I want or need right now?
What could I do right now which would be useful?
Does that make sense?

I'm 50/50 with this.

She excluded you for a reason. I'd bring it up maturely and be calm about it. Let her know you were a bit offended and want to know what the deal is.

There is a good chance that your friends are not your friends. Did they meet you or her first before you guys became "friends?" If you were a friend after her, then they are never going to be on your side.

A very good chance she's been thinking about your relationship and this is her time away to see what is out there. This is why I'm 50/50 on whether she's cheating on you or not. If she's loyal, she will see there are other opportunities, not act, and then proceed to either break up with you or complicate the relationship in a way that just makes things worse for the both of you. The alternative, she cheats.

I would take a step back and analyze your relationship. Is it healthy? Do you do things to upset her? Does she do things to upset you? Does she seem distant or uncaring at times? Good communication? Any issues that are recent or not? Does she have a history of cheating or using men for attention? Does she crave attention in general, be it just her friends or you?

I would consider the possibility that your relationship either needs work, or you need to end it before she does. Trust me, do it first. You'll feel better in the long run and will have a better mental foundation for the one that comes next.

posts.sub: Everything is just business, a long series of transactions
posts.com:
Your friends talk to you because they have a biological need to do so and feel lonely when they don't. Usually this is a win win, however in some cases there are other reasons that make it a loss for you. For example, you're really good at academics, you may have some friends who mooch of you. In this case, they get more value relatively to you meaning you lose.

Your girl loves you because she can be protected and provided to. She's winning. In this transaction, she's getting objectively more out of you than you are getting out of her.

The job you work at provides you the bare minimum in order to maximize their profits. There are arguments that you are taking less risk and what not but this transaction in general is still a loss in your case.

There is a selfish reason for everything. That's the belief I've arrived to after a few years. The moment I lost my value as a man (got fired from a respectable job), I lost most of my friends. People who I thought I connected with no longer converse with me simply because there is no longer any value or benefit to do so. It's selfish and yet I understand, it's just business.

How can there be love when every decision we make can be boiled down to selfish reasons? Are the people who give money to beggars really good people? They give the minimum in order to feel good about themselves, it's selfish.

The moment you lose your value, surprise surprise, you become worthless. I don't believe in love or friendships. I don't believe in "give and take". You can give whatever you want, but you will always be at a net loss. Someone will always be winning in your stead, using you to further your agenda.

Sales people, marketers, influencers. These people all trick/persuade you to purchase their product. You may feel like you won a little bit but ultimately they won a lot more.

This again is the reality I've come to accept. I am also a part of it. I hope I'm wrong but it's hard to say now. Living like this is soul crushing.

posts.com:
>>28271387
You are treating mutually beneficial transactions as if they were zero sum, which is not true in the slightest. If both people in a transaction benefit, they are both winners regardless of who benefits more. For example, imagine you and a friend have a chance to invest $1 each and if you do you win $1000000 and he wins $1000001. Even though your friend technically gets more of a benefit, you are definitely still winning in this transaction.
This principle is actually behind the free market. In any transaction, both the producer and the consumer must benefit for the transaction to be made. So for example, the consumer thinks a milk carton is worth 5 dollars while a milk producer spends 1 dollar per milk carton. If milk is sold for $4, even though the producer technically gets a $3 surplus while the consumer only gets a $1 surplus, the move is still beneficial for both and there is a net gain in value.
Your problem is not from society, but in your incorrect viewpoint on non zero-sum cooperative games in game theory. Even if you are as nihilistic as this, there is nothing wrong with these transactions and they are still a boon to you.

I did the same thing and got the same result. My theory is that it's us having a misunderstanding of what "normies" are like.

They are not super extroverted people who like to be around others and making new friends. They interact with other people because they have too, they are primarily driven in life by fear, two fears in specific;

>The fear of being single
>The fear that other people are more successful than they are.

Once they have alleviated those fears, they shut down and have no desire to talk to people. They would much rather stay home and watch netflix. They only seek out new social situations when those fears are reawakened and will only maintain social contact if you are the foundation for keeping those fears at bay. They in reality hate other people, because other people make them feel insecure.

The problem now you are having is once people are in mid-late 20s they start to get married "settle down" they have for the foreseeable future solved those problems. They are not single and view themselves as successful. They no longer want or require new social interactions which is why things never escalate or last. I'm 33 now. It has never gotten better since it started in my mid 20s. Eventually you'll realize that the whole thing of being socially successful was never real, it was a fantasy you created because you never felt connected.

>My family don’t really get anything, not bad people, just clueless.
Yup. I just completely stopped talking to them about anything to do with my life beyond surface level stuff, they don't get it and when I did talk about my plans all I got is negativity, so I just stopped.

You learn to live with it. The things I've found most helpful is, in order, finding a spiritual practice that works for me, keeping a journal, and reading.

Reading is great because you actually can find other people who get it, who got it and who understand. Don't read anything new, go back at least 80 years. You'll find people who you feel like you know personally, it's very surreal.

In my journal I will write responses to passages in the books I'm reading, sometimes it feels like a pen pal. Or I just keep a log of thoughts that I've been going over, important events, whatever. It sounds dumb and I resisted it for a long time but once I got started and made it a regular thing it's one of my favorite things to do.

Read books about spirituality/philosophy/occult or anything adjacent. For me personally a lot of stuff didn't start making sense until after I read 'Hero with A Thousand Faces' but start where ever it makes sense for you. Once you start knowing "God" in whatever term you prefer, it makes the loneliness easier to bear, knowing that your life being the way that it is and the world in general is a function with a purpose and what it means that your life is like this. We are not like them because we were meant for something different, we are called to do something they don't have the capability of doing. I hope you can find out what that is anon.

None of you idiots know how the rating system works. You kids need to actually understand the system if you're going to use it. If you don't want to understand it, just use vague words like "very" so we know it's your subjective opinion and not an actual measurement. Subjective attraction is relative, it changes by individual based on all kinds of factors.

Leagues are based on symmetry, gender/racial based features and proportions. They aren't a measure of subjective attraction, but objective genetic superiority. Maybe you might call it "classical beauty" but it's really about the wholeness of their genome.

It's standardised measure. The kind of thing you can run through software to get an answer and indeed such software exists in abundance. You don't need software to figure it out, but it exists these days because why not, retards like you might need it.

You are born into a league and you stay there your entire life. If you're a 5/10 and gain weight, you're a fat 5/10. If you're a 5/10 and you don't take care of yourself you're probably not a very attractive 5/10.

Going to the gym doesn't change your league, it just makes you more attractive INSIDE your league.

For reference. Brad Pitt is an 8/10. Picrel is a 6/10. The OP girl is a 4-5/10, we could run her through software to be definitive on whether she's a 4/10 or a 5/10 but calling her in that general range is good enough.

A league tells you where you rank compared to others and whether you're even in the running to be a potential mate for them. No one fucks down. A 5/10 goes for other 5/10s, if you're a 3/10 you're out of luck.

posts.com: What kind of photos would be good for a tinder profile? I’m good looking so no problem with that but I’m pretty autistic and have barely got any pics of me apart from selfies: What photos are good?

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>28272749
Non selfies

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>28272749
Selfies are bad. Close up head shots and mirror pics. Your photos should cover 4 basic things:
-One in which you are smiling
-One in which you are doing some kind of activity (going outside, playing a sport, playing an instrument, etc.)
-One in which you are doing something social or with friends/family (Picture with you and a couple friends somewhere in town, with any siblings, parents or cousins at an event like a wedding, graduation, bbq, or something like that)
-One in which you are demonstrating some aspect of your personality or interests (it can be the same as #2, but in this case could be you at a restaurant/cafe/shop you like to frequent, practicing a skill or hobby, etc.)
The problem that most guys have that girls don't is that they rarely get their picture taken unless they ask so don't be embarrassed to ask a friend to take some pics of you if you think you have a good photo op for your profile.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>28272749
This should be a sticky on this board. Also, beware of group photos: you have to 1) stand out and 2) stand out positively. Girls don't like to try finding you among your group and you don't want your friends to mog you. If you're still hesitating, know that your profile is only as good as your worse photo. Girls always look for that one thing that'll make them left-swipe guys.

Your doctor offered to prescribe you anxiety medication. That is the correct thing to do in such a situation. Did you say "I would like a referral to a psychologist?

Please be aware, you do not need a referral from a GP to see a psychologist nor any allied health practitioner, you simply call up and make an appointment. There is an out of pocket fee associated. You're looking at somewhere between £90-£300 per session.

GPs are not referring to NHS psychologists as much for the same reason they aren't referring to hospital right now. They've been told not to due to system funding issues.
